page.title: 14ROWNEY WOOD part 2
page.content: .....They are gradually felling the middle row of each three rows of Norway Spruce and will continue to thin them. The aim is to have an{oak {wood}in about{50 years}time. Conifers are planted with the oaks to assist the oaks to grow up straight and true. Once the oak trees are established the conifers are thinned. The tops of{Norway Spruce}are sold as{Christmas Trees}and the trunks as{fence posts.}If the wood is bent it is used for paper or firewood. Both{rabbit}and{fox snares}are used in the wood. The rabbit snares are fairly common however permission must be obtained from the Forestry Commission before fox snares can be laid .There are two types of{pressure {pad traps (with/without teeth).}The one with teeth has been made illegal due to the pain it caused the animals.
